title: How to Make Fresh Citrus Tea (Orange, Lemon, or Lime)

steps.headline: Place the selected slices of citrus fruit at the base of the tea glass.
steps.description: There should be two for each glass. You can mix flavours if wished but it is a good idea to start with one flavour until you know which flavours that you prefer.

steps.headline: Pour a splash of boiling water over each of the fruit slices sitting in the glasses.
steps.description: Allow to sit for a minute or two to allow the citrus oils to release and infuse the water.

steps.headline: Fill up the glasses with black tea.
steps.description: The tea should be weak to normal, not strong-tasting.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add a slice or two to the side of the glass and enjoy.

text: Place the selected slices of citrus fruit at the base of the tea glass. There should be two for each glass. You can mix flavours if wished but it is a good idea to start with one flavour until you know which flavours that you prefer. Pour a splash of boiling water over each of the fruit slices sitting in the glasses. Allow to sit for a minute or two to allow the citrus oils to release and infuse the water. Fill up the glasses with black tea. The tea should be weak to normal, not strong-tasting. Sweeten to taste if wished.  Serve. Add a slice or two to the side of the glass and enjoy.
